articles.title: About Me
articles.contents:
Michael Weylandt is currently an Intelligence Community Postdoctoral Fellow, working with George Michailidis at the University of Florida. His work focuses on statistical machine learning theory for structured multivariate time series, viewed through a graphical model lens. His work has been recognized with best paper awards from the American Statistical Association in both Statistical Learning and Data Science and in Business & Economic Statistics. He has served as a mentor in the Google Summer of Code program for 7 years on behalf of the R Foundation for Statistical Computing and previously held an NSF Graduate Research Fellowship. Prior to beginning his Ph.D. studies, he worked at Morgan Stanley as a quantitative analyst, focusing on derivatives pricing and financial risk management. He received a Bachelor’s of Science in Engineering from Princeton University in 2008 and a Ph.D. in Statistics from Rice University in 2020.
For more details, see my Full CV.

articles.title: Contact Information
articles.contents: Like most folks, I continue to work remotely most days. If you want to get in touch, please email me at michael.weylandt@ufl.edu or give me a call at 713-204-9366.

articles.title: Welcome!
articles.contents: Hello and welcome to my website! My name is Michael Weylandt. I am currently an US Intelligence Community Postdoctoral Research Fellow hosted at the University of Florida Informatics Institute, where I am advised by George Michailidis as well as two mentors from the Intelligence Community. Before this, I earned my Ph.D. at Rice University in 2020, worked in finance from 2013 to 2015, and taught at Sherborne School in the UK from 2012 to 2013. My research is in statistical machine learning, with a recent focus on network data and in machine learning fairness. For a more formal bio and my CV, please see my About page and for more detail on my Publications and Software, please see those pages as well.

articles.title: Publications
articles.contents:
Below is a list of my publications: for more details on each publication, click for details.
Submitted
M. Weylandt and G. Michailidis. “Coupled CP Decomposition for Principal Components Analysis of Symmetric Networks”
M. Weylandt and G. I. Allen. “Debiasing Projections for Fair Principal Components Analysis”
M. Navarro, G. I. Allen, and M. Weylandt. “Network Clustering for Latent State and Changepoint Detection.”
M. Weylandt, Y. Han, and K. B. Ensor. “Multivariate Modeling of Natural Gas Spot Trading Hubs Incorporating Futures Market Realized Volatility”
Winner of the ASA Section on Business and Economic Statistics (B&E) 2020 Student Paper Competition
A.P. Drager, M. Weylandt, G. Chuyong, D. Kenfack, D.W. Thomas, and A.E. Dunham. “Ecological correlates of reproductive status in a guild of Afrotropical understory trees.”
